intro: Commiphora schlechteri, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and leathery, elliptical leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by fragrant, resinous sap that has been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes. The botanical features of Commiphora schlechteri make it a unique and valuable species in its native habitat.
